articles.author: John Kruzel, Andrew Chung
articles.description: Republican Donald Trump's return to the presidency is expected to precipitate a shift in the U.S. government's legal stance in major cases pending at the Supreme Court, including a closely watched dispute involving Tennessee's ban on gender-affirming medical care for transgender minors.
articles.title: Under Trump, US government legal stance poised to shift at Supreme Court

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli authorities have caused a forced displacement of Palestinian people in Gaza to an extent that constitutes war crimes and crimes against humanity, Human Rights Watch said in a report on Thursday.
articles.title: Human Rights Watch accuses Israel of war crimes over Gaza displacements

articles.author: Michael Martina
articles.description: With his nomination of China hardliner Marco Rubio for secretary of state, U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has signaled his policy toward Beijing could go beyond his focus on tariffs and trade to a more hawkish stance towards China as the United States' top strategic rival.
articles.title: Rubio pick signals a Trump China policy that could go beyond tariffs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkey was offered partner country status by the BRICS group of nations, Trade Minister Omer Bolat said, as Ankara continues what it calls its efforts to balance its Eastern and Western ties.
articles.title: BRICS offered Turkey partner country status, Turkish trade minister says

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: South Korea's Supreme Court upheld on Thursday the conviction of the former head of an advocacy group representing victims of Japan's wartime sexual abuse for embezzlement and sentenced her to 18 months in prison, suspended for three years.
articles.title: South Korea top court upholds conviction of 'comfort women' activist over embezzlement

articles.author: Kate Abnett, Olesya Astakhova, Virginia Furness, Simon Jessop
articles.description: Experts said poor states need at least $1 trillion per year by the end of the decade to move to greener energy and protect against extreme weather.
articles.title: COP29 climate talks urged to find $1 trillion a year for poorer countries

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Plumes of smoke rose over Beirut, while airstrikes and artillery shelling inflicted heavy damage on buildings in southern Lebanon’s Bint Jbeil.
articles.title: Israel strikes Hezbollah areas in Beirut, southern Lebanon for third day

articles.author: Sergio Goncalves, Giselda Vagnoni, Gergely Szakacs, Charlie Devereux
articles.description: Talent flight to wealthier countries of the north is a problem for southern and central Europe, as workers take advantage of freedom of movement rules within the trade bloc.
articles.title: Borderless Europe fights brain drain as talent heads north

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Former Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen is planning to visit Canada next week, two diplomatic sources told Reuters, in a highly watched visit for a senior Taiwan politician who has a become a symbol of the island's defiance against China's military threat.
articles.title: Former Taiwan president Tsai to visit Canada next week, sources say

articles.author: Tim Kelly
articles.description: U.S., Japanese and South Korean naval forces exercised together in East Asian waters on Thursday in their most complex and final joint drills before President Joe Biden hands over one of his signature national security initiatives to Donald Trump.
articles.title: In shadow of new Trump term, Japan and S.Korea join US in Asian naval drill
